item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, November 4, 2024 at 2:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Limitations of Frame Pointer Unwinding (34 points | 4 comments)
2. Cheap Thrills, an album cover by Robert Crumb (2020) (84 points | 28 comments)
3. The history of Unix's ioctl and signal about window sizes (56 points | 5 comments)
4. Scientists glue two proteins together, driving cancer cells to self-destruct (456 points | 119 comments)
5. Is the Q Source the Origin of the Gospels? (42 points | 28 comments)
6. A 94x speed improvement demonstrated using handwritten assembly (30 points | 19 comments)
7. Show HN: SplatGallery – A Community-Driven Gallery for Gaussian Splats (23 points | 4 comments)
8. The Secret of Ramsey Numbers (17 points | 1 comment)
9. An embarrassingly simple approach to recover unlearned knowledge for LLMs (174 points | 65 comments)
10. PropelAuth (YC W22) is hiring Fullstack and Rust engineers ( | hide)
11. Project Sid: Many-agent simulations toward AI civilization (345 points | 105 comments)
12. The Saga of a Celebrated Scientist – and His Rodent Dystopia (20 points | 5 comments)
13. Hertz-dev, the first open-source base model for conversational audio (198 points | 38 comments)
14. Scalable watermarking for identifying large language model outputs (22 points | 5 comments)
15. Touchscreens are out, and tactile controls are back (1067 points | 741 comments)
16. A Hamiltonian Circuit for Rubik's Cube (81 points | 22 comments)
17. pg_flo – Stream, transform, and re-route PostgreSQL data in real-time (202 points | 37 comments)
18. To what extent is science a strong-link problem? (4 points | discuss)
19. The heartbreak behind Dorothy Parker's wit (9 points | 3 comments)
20. A Missing IDE Feature (27 points | 23 comments)
21. I've had a change of heart regarding employee metrics (351 points | 196 comments)
22. The Submerged Nabataean Temple in Puteoli at Pozzuoli, Italy (56 points | 19 comments)
23. Programming languages that blew my mind (2023) (286 points | 164 comments)
24. Interview gone wrong (129 points | 166 comments)
25. PacCam: Pac-Man controlled with your face (41 points | 9 comments)
26. Top discoveries about ancient people from DNA in 2023 (76 points | 5 comments)
27. Once Linux's Biggest Enemy: Darl McBride Dies and Nobody Notices (16 points | 7 comments)
28. gptel: a simple LLM client for Emacs (141 points | 28 comments)
29. Ritonavir Form III: A Coincidental Concurrent Discovery (18 points | 4 comments)
30. Missing open-source contributor presents a dilemma when accepting their PR (83 points | 56 comments)
